item.title: F5 warns of critical BIG-IP RCE bug allowing device takeover
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: F5 has issued a security advisory warning about a flaw that may allow unauthenticated attackers with network access to execute arbitrary system commands, perform file actions, and disable services on BIG-IP. [...]

item.title: Cisco fixes NFVIS bugs that help gain root and hijack hosts
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: Cisco has addressed several security flaws found in the Enterprise NFV Infrastructure Software (NFVIS), a solution that helps virtualize network services for easier management of virtual network functions (VNFs). [...]

item.title: Pixiv, DeviantArt artists hit by NFT job offers pushing malware
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: Users on Pixiv, DeviantArt, and other creator-oriented online platforms report receiving multiple messages from people claiming to be from the "Cyberpunk Ape Executives" NFT project, with the main goal to infect artists' devices with information-stealing malware. [...]

item.title: Attackers hijack UK NHS email accounts to steal Microsoft logins
item.dc:creator: Ionut Ilascu
item.description: For about half a year, work email accounts belonging to over 100 employees of the National Health System (NHS) in the U.K. were used in several phishing campaigns, some aiming to steal Microsoft logins. [...]

item.title: Heroku forces user password resets but fails to explain why
item.dc:creator: Lawrence Abrams
item.description: Salesforce-owned Heroku is performing a forced password reset on a subset of user accounts in response to last month's security incident while providing no information as to why they are doing so other than vaguely mentioning it is to further secure accounts. [...]

item.title: FBI says business email compromise is a $43 billion scam
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: The Federal Bureau of Investigation (FBI) said today that the amount of money lost to business email compromise (BEC) scams continues to grow each year, with a 65% increase in the identified global exposed losses between July 2019 and December 2021. [...]

item.title: Hackers stole data undetected from US, European orgs since 2019
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: Cybersecurity analysts have exposed a lengthy operation attributed to the group of Chinese hackers known as "Winnti" and tracked as APT41, which focused on stealing intellectual property assets like patents, copyrights, trademarks, and other types of valuable data. [...]

item.title: GitHub to require 2FA from active developers by the end of 2023
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: GitHub announced today that all users who contribute code on its platform (an estimated 83 million developers in total) will be required to enable two-factor authentication (2FA) on their accounts by the end of 2023. [...]

item.title: Microsoft: Windows 11 KB5012643 update will break some apps
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: Microsoft has warned Windows 11 users that they might experience issues launching and using some .NET Framework 3.5 applications. [...]

item.title: Using PowerShell to manage password resets in Windows domains
item.dc:creator: Sponsored by Specops
item.description: With breaches running rampant, it's common to force password resets on your Windows domain. This article shows how admins can use PowerShell to manage password resets and introduce software that makes it even easier. [...]

item.title: Pro-Ukraine hackers use Docker images to DDoS Russian sites
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: Docker images with a download count of over 150,000 have been used to run distributed denial-of-service (DDoS) attacks against a dozen Russian and Belarusian websites managed by government, military, and news organizations. [...]

item.title: Mitsubishi Electric faked safety and quality control tests for decades
item.dc:creator: Ax Sharma
item.description: Mitsubishi Electric, one of the world's leading providers of large-scale electrical and HVAC systems has admitted to fraudulently conducting quality assurance tests on its transformers—for decades. [...]

item.title: Microsoft warns Exchange Online basic auth will be disabled
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: Microsoft warned customers today that it will start disabling Basic Authentication in random tenants worldwide on October 1, 2022. [...]
